A 24 años de su publicación, me di la oportunidad de jugar esta joya de los shooters en primera persona. El juego es agradable y muy bueno desde que comienza hasta que termina. La trama es de lo mejor que he visto y la gama de enemigos que tiene me ha encantado. Hay algunas cosas que no me gustaron como por ejemplo, que tiene muchos bugs que nunca se arreglaron y que el personaje al moverlo se mueve muy rápido haciendo que sea difícil moverse por plataformas o lugares muy estrechos. En todo lo demás es perfecto y la verdad es que siendo un juego del 98, se ve super bien en cuanto a los gráficos y las mecánicas del juego. En resumen, altamente recomendado.

Como já diria o nosso querido Gordon Freeman naquele trenzinho do inicio: "............".

Conheço esse jogo a tantos anos e ainda sou completamente apaixonada, POREM, o som desses bichos ainda me causam agonia junto com um estranho pensamento de ''como deve ser um churrasquinho deles hmmmm", com certeza devem ter aquele temperinho com gostinho de radiação...

Deixando as brincadeiras a parte, voltei a jogar neste ano e recomendo a todos, a sensação incrível de zerar e ouvir a musiquinha, nunca irei esquecer. 

HL sempre será um dos meus jogos favoritos <3

joya de joyas

I was planning on skipping this title and watching a letsplay so I could jump straight to Half-Life 2. I was more interested in the story and I knew the slippery controls would be a pain in my ass, but on a whim, I decided, "eh fuck it, might as well play it" and I am so glad that I did. While yes, the platforming sucks ass, I can't deny that this game is super fun. The puzzles were super rewarding to solve and I easily found myself immersed in the dark halls of Black Mesa. I can't believe it took me this long to finally play this gem. I adored the ending and I am so excited to play the second game!

A real classic and super glad to have played this. It really is amazing to consider that this game was released in the 90s, it has more variety and excitement than many games released recently. 

I only experienced one real game-breaking bug where I got stuck in a door on the train ride, but fortunately this was early on in the first level so I could just restart. Every other part of the game played perfectly on a modern machine.
Esto es una maravilla bro!

I never played the first 4 half life games until now, in fact as the writing of this review, I have not even finished half life 1 (I got the bundle including blue shift and opposing force btw) this is because I was born right after half life 2 came out, and I played that on the orange box, good times. But besides that, half life 1 so far is probably one of my personal favs atm. I am currently at "Forget Freeman!". I don't know anything about opposing force or blue shift or decay, but I can say that half life 1 is probably my second favorite valve game, first is of course half life 2. But, please, PLEASE, get this game. It is so worth it, in fact, get the half life complete bundle to get all the games. So worth it. (also, the reason I have so much hours already, is because I have restarted 5 times due to disatisfaction of my playthroughs. That does not mean its a bad game by the way! I just think that I could have done something better, or just because I like the earlier chapters a lot more. Also,' on a rail ' sucks but I'm not here to talk about that.)
Half-Life is truly a masterpiece of a series, and that statement still shines true in the first game. For 1998 this is still holding up today and has aged like fine wine.
